alert.note: Alert for Lower Clark Fork Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 28 at 2:32PM MST until March 01 at 8:00AM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation. Additional snow accumulations of one to two inches above 4000 feet, including over Lookout Pass. Precipitation will change to rain by Monday evening but a light glaze of ice is possible on the cold ground. * WHERE...Evaro Hill, Highway 200 Thompson Falls to Plains, Highway 200 Trout Creek to Heron, and I-90 Lookout Pass to Haugan. * WHEN...Until 8 AM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be affected. Lower valleys will see rain today, but icy conditions will redevelop tonight after sunset as sub-surface temperatures remain below freezing. Expect variable conditions over short distances.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
